full_threads.body: Re: hi guys, Im trying to live the site entcaresydney.com.au (install e...

You're welcome!

--

https://static.intercomassets.com/avatars/1421385/square_128/mugshot-1525818766.png?1525818766 James from Kinsta

On Mon, Jul 30, 2018 at 11:22 AM, "WP Perk Support Team" <support@wpperk.com> wrote:

Ok cool, no probs : )

Thanks@

On Mon, Jul 30, 2018 at 11:22 AM, "James Fraser" <james.fraser@kinsta.intercom-mail.com> wrote:

Yeah, no recommendations I'm afraid. :(

On Mon, Jul 30, 2018 at 11:18 AM, "James Fraser" <james.fraser@kinsta.intercom-mail.com> wrote:

No worries, yeah just throw that into the "Custom SSL" section of MyKinsta, make sure Cloudflare isn't set to "Strict" SSL and then you should be set.

I'll ask our marketing folks if we've got any partners that do SSL certs, I'm not aware of any recommendations though.

On Mon, Jul 30, 2018 at 11:17 AM, "WP Perk Support Team" <support@wpperk.com> wrote:

I can grab it. Cheers

Also, whilst I have you. I need an EV cert for another site. Do you guys have any preferred companies?

On Mon, Jul 30, 2018 at 11:16 AM, "James Fraser" <james.fraser@kinsta.intercom-mail.com> wrote:

Umm, sure, but it's probably easier for you to grab it via SFTP? The cert+key are in the ~/private/ directory on that site. You can use that same cert for any other site, it's just a self-signed certificate with all the default settings (it's not even valid for the same hostname).

Did you want me to attach them here or can you grab them via SFTP?

On Mon, Jul 30, 2018 at 11:15 AM, "WP Perk Support Team" <support@wpperk.com> wrote:

Cool, are you able to send me the cert you used?

On Mon, Jul 30, 2018 at 11:15 AM, "James Fraser" <james.fraser@kinsta.intercom-mail.com> wrote:

Yeah, if you don't have a certificate to drop in the box (I think it's easier to do it that way), that's correct... Click the orange cloud to turn it grey, on *all* the hostnames that are going to be on the LetsEncrypt certificate. Then try generate LE (if it fails, wait 5 minutes), then turn them all back on.

On Mon, Jul 30, 2018 at 11:13 AM, "WP Perk Support Team" <support@wpperk.com> wrote:

Ok cool, so when I do this again with cloudflare, I should always: click the orange cloud to not send traffic through cloud

*through cloud fare

On Mon, Jul 30, 2018 at 11:11 AM, "James Fraser" <james.fraser@kinsta.intercom-mail.com> wrote:

It's already going, should be fine without having done that... just in future though that should fix it (probably wait about 5 minutes after turning the Cloud off though, due to DNS TTLs).

Yeah LetsEncrypt just finished.

You do also have some mixed content warnings as well though: https://www.whynopadlock.com/results/033867b2-5dd7-4e1d-844f-438f0a1076f5

On Mon, Jul 30, 2018 at 11:10 AM, "WP Perk Support Team" <support@wpperk.com> wrote:

Ok cool, I've turned them off now. Should I try the let's encrypt one now

On Mon, Jul 30, 2018 at 11:09 AM, "James Fraser" <james.fraser@kinsta.intercom-mail.com> wrote:

Nope looks like it's all good - what we do is just drop any other certificate in the site to stop HTTPS from forwarding back to HTTP. That's brought the site up, and now LetsEncrypt *should* work this time.

If you don't have another certificate available (I just generated a self-signed one, but literally any certificate will work as long as HTTPS isn't set to "Full (Strict)"), then clicking those orange clouds to turn the Cloudflare cloud off should let LetsEncrypt work.

On Mon, Jul 30, 2018 at 11:08 AM, "WP Perk Support Team" <support@wpperk.com> wrote:

Ah ok... do you want me to do as flexible for now?

On Mon, Jul 30, 2018 at 11:07 AM, "James Fraser" <james.fraser@kinsta.intercom-mail.com> wrote:

Ahh okay, so "Full" won't work until there's an SSL certificate on Kinsta's side (which is probably what's stopping LetsEncrypt from working also), I think I can fix that from our side.

On Mon, Jul 30, 2018 at 11:05 AM, "WP Perk Support Team" <support@wpperk.com> wrote:

Yep and crypto set to full

screenshotsL

https://downloads.intercomcdn.com/i/o/69687959/0ffca400fb6c08ec974363a1/Screen+Shot+2018-07-30+at+11.04.33+am.png

https://downloads.intercomcdn.com/i/o/69687961/04794f9ed1e8536dfa51470f/Screen+Shot+2018-07-30+at+11.04.28+am.png

On Mon, Jul 30, 2018 at 11:04 AM, "James Fraser" <james.fraser@kinsta.intercom-mail.com> wrote:

Is the IP address correct on Cloudflare? What are the crypto settings set to?

If I skip Cloudflare it seems to respond fine:

$ curl -I --resolve entcaresydney.com.au:80:35.189.58.105 http://entcaresydney.com.au
HTTP/1.1 200 OK
Server: kinsta-nginx
Date: Mon, 30 Jul 2018 01:03:20 GMT
Content-Type: text/html; charset=UTF-8
Connection: keep-alive
Vary: Accept-Encoding
Vary: Accept-Encoding
Link: <http://entcaresydney.com.au/wp-json/>; rel="https://api.w.org/"
Link: <http://entcaresydney.com.au/>; rel=shortlink
X-Kinsta-Cache: HIT
X-Content-Type-Options: nosniff

On Mon, Jul 30, 2018 at 11:01 AM, "James Fraser" <james.fraser@kinsta.intercom-mail.com> wrote:

Having a look at this for you now!

On Mon, Jul 30, 2018 at 11:00 AM, "WP Perk Support Team" <support@wpperk.com> wrote:

hi guys, Im trying to live the site entcaresydney.com.au (install entcaresydney) and not having much success.

It looks like there was a database issue, but I fixed that, now its saying the server is not responding... any ideas? I'm seeing the 502 message from cloudflare
